results.title: Farm boy of Hungary
results.creator_credit: Vue Touristique Film Studios and Gabor Kalman
results.brief_description: The pace, feel, and values of the rural way of life that is still a part of Central Europe today. Lajos, a farm boy, is shown living the normal life in Hungary. Modern conveniences may be lacking, but Lajos and his family “have everything we need”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vue Touristique Film Studios and Gabor Kalman

results.title: Farm animals
results.brief_description: A visit to an American farm where cows, horses, pigs, goats and sheep and their young are introduced to city children who might not otherwise have an opportunity to study domestic animals.

results.title: Farewell Oak Street
results.creator_credit: Gordon Burwash, ONF | NFB and Grant McLean
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of what a low-rental housing project can mean to the people who once shared aged, sub-standard dwellings. A before-and-after picture about people in a large-scale public housing project in Toronto, who, because of the housing shortage, had been forced to live in squalid, dingy flats, all-purpose rooms, and ramshackle houses on a crowded street in Regent Park North. These people were freed through housing development to inhabit new, modern dwellings planned to give a measure of privacy, light and air.

results.title: Farewell Moscow
results.creator_credit: Enrico Roseo, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Mauro Bolognini
results.brief_description: Ida Nudel, played by Liv Ullmann in one of the finest performances of her career, is a Russian scientist, a violinist and a Jew. She dearly loves her sister Elena, and Juli, a young poet interned as a dissident. She loves the synagogue, she even loves her ex-husband. But most of all she loves Russia, and does not want to leave. As the Jewish persecutions grow more violent she finally decides the time has come to leave Russia, for her personal safety. Through all her trials and tribulations her old spirit remains unbroken and she becomes an inspiration to a whole generation of Russian Jews.

results.title: Farewell Arabia
results.creator_credit: International Television Federation, Rediffusion and Randal Beattie
results.brief_description: An account of what the discovery of oil has done to the tiny sheikdom of Abu Dhabi whose population of 200,000 were still living a simple life. The film shows the continuity of old customs and the incursion of new pressures brought about by foreign salesmen wanting to sell their goods and expertise in return for the oil-fed dollars. Also shows 20th century medicine trying to battle TB, eye diseases and the traditionalism of the people. Written and narrated by David Holden.

results.title: Farang Monk
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Craig Kirchner and Roger Vickery
results.brief_description: John Robbins is an ex-American teacher who, dissatisfied with life in America decided to travel. After visiting many countries, he finally becomes a Farang Monk living in Thailand. He talks about his decision and the personal attempts to find the middle road between excessive goal orientation and totally dropping out.

results.title: Far out kids animation
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, Peter Nicholson, Steve French and Anthony Lucas
results.brief_description: The AFI put together this compilation of Australian animated films suitable for children under nine. It includes: “There’s Dragons” - a funny film about a silly dragon, “That’s Progress” - a young boy doing a school project on historic buildings is constantly thwarted by Mr Progress, who keeps demolishing the buildings to put up car parks, “The Lighthouse Made Three” a whimsical love story based on a popular song. “Thumpalong” about a king who hates music, and “DuDu and the Line”, a celebration of the wild and free flowing transformations available to the animator.

results.title: Far from Heaven
results.creator_credit: Focus Features, Vulcan Productions, Jody Patton, Christine Vachon and Todd Haynes
results.brief_description: Mrs Cathy Whitaker (Julianne Moore) is the equivalent of the 1950s super mom - running the household for her busy executive husband and two young children with the help of her African American maid Sybil. She has a busy social circle, doing good deeds for the community, all whilst being impeccably dressed and coiffured. But this nuclear family is not what it seems as the husband (Dennis Quaid) has a secret passion that cannot be quelled. A friendship with the gardener (Dennis Haysbert), an African American single father, develops into something deeper for Cathy but society deems their acquaintance as simply unacceptable. A film about relationships and society where people’s desires and needs are often at odds with a repressed moral code/sense of ethics, especially in 1950s America. Written and directed by Todd Haynes, with music by Elmer Bernstein. Highly stylised art direction and costume design appropriate to the period. Cast includes Viola Davis, Patricia Clarkson, Celia Weston.

results.title: Far East
results.brief_description: A political thriller which exposes the violent and exploitative realities of multi-national companies in SE Asia. Against this background, three Australians drift between stability and desperation. This is a tough story of human emotions stretched to the limit by war, love and mystery. Cast includes Helen Morse and Bryan Brown.
